inclusion.criterion: Patient, male or female, over 18 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Not in progression (clinico-radiological criterion RANO, (Wen et al., 2014))
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: No increase greater than 25% in contrast enhancement after gadolinium injection
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: No increase in the T2 / FLAIR hyper signal
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of drug-resistant epilepsy according to international epilepsy definitions
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Repeated epileptic seizures despite testing of two effective dose antiepileptic drugs tried at least 3 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: With at least 2 attacks per month (to ensure visibility on the duration of the study of the antiepileptic effect)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Patient with epileptic seizures not limited to only subjective signs
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: No affiliation to a social security scheme (beneficiary or beneficiary)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Person of legal age subject to a legal protection measure (major under guardianship, guardianship or court order), or unable to express his or her consent
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient with at least 2 generalized tonic-clonic seizures per month.
exclusion.label: met

notes: 41 year old man with history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, epilepsy presenting with facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in at his NH which required 20 mg valium to cease seizure activity. Per outside medical patient was felt to have focal epilepsy with secondary generalization, likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth, and probably related to the atrophic changes seen on MRI, particularly in the left temporal lobe.
